channel.title: Keyboard on mb's blog
channel.description: Recent content in Keyboard on mb's blog

item.title: Iris Querty Layout
item.description:
Iris default QUERTY layout On february I started to use my Iris keyboard ordered from keeb.io. I used the default layout in the first few days, but I didn’t typed well or in other words I didn’t feel good with it. E.g. enter is there where I’m used to use space. The navigation is completely on on other places where I want to have it.
For that reason I changed the default layout and moved the keys around to a layout which feels hopefully a bit better.

item.title: Iris Keyboard Build Log
item.description:
Last year I started to type with a mechanical keyboard. I bought a Vortex Core. This keyboard was quite impressive for me because this keyboard is a mechanical one, I can program it and the size is small (40%).
After some time I recognized, the programming mode is not convenient enough for me. There is no way to program my vortex core based on a config file. I have to press some keystrokes to reorder my keys.
